meanings.definition: A cause of great distress or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The loud construction noise was a bane to my peaceful afternoon.
meanings.sent2: Mosquitoes are a common bane during summer evenings.
meanings.sent3: The constant barking of the neighbor's dog, a true bane, made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was the bane of commuters' existence.
meanings.sent5: The persistent ringing of the alarm clock became a bane to his mornings.

meanings.definition: Something that causes harm or ruin.
meanings.sent1: The invasive species proved to be a bane to the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting regular maintenance can be the bane of any machine.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk in the fridge turned into a bane for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal of trust can be a bane that lingers for years.
meanings.sent5: The leaky roof became a bane during the rainy season.

meanings.definition: To be the bane of someone's existence.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints bane her friends' patience.
meanings.sent2: Procrastination can easily bane your productivity.
meanings.sent3: His love for practical jokes tends to bane his sister's nerves.
meanings.sent4: The lack of communication can bane relationships.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending paperwork bane the office workers' efficiency.
